ctu_text: gov. in/User/rupashree_prakalpa"}, {"name": "Definition 2", "definition": [{"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "Here are some key definitions related to the scheme:", "bold": true, "italic": true}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": ""}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "Rupashree:", "bold": true}, {"text": " The word \"Rupashree\" is derived from two Bengali words: \"Rupa,\" meaning beauty, and \"Shree,\" meaning wealth. The scheme aims to help families provide a beautiful and dignified wedding ceremony for their daughters. "}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": ""}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "Beneficiary:", "bold": true}, {"text": " The beneficiary of the Rupashree Prakalpa Scheme is the unmarried girl from an economically disadvantaged family whose marriage is being facilitated by the scheme.

"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": ""}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "Income Certificate:", "bold": true}, {"text": " An income certificate is a document issued by the government that certifies the income of an individual or a family. The income certificate is required to verify the eligibility of the family for the scheme.

", "italic": true}]}]}], "schemeDefinitions": [{"name": "Definition 1", "definition": [{"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "In this Scheme, unless the context otherwise requires:"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": ""}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "\"Marriage\" means and includes a marriage between a couple belonging to any caste or religion or tribe under any law or custom or usage in any form or manner recognized by the law or marriage registered under any law, except a re-marriage.
